intro: Carlowrightia arizonica, commonly known as Arizona false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
